text: also possible aggregate values kind category. useful BED files ID individual entity rather category, instance, ChromHMM annotations: possible get single value per category using aggregate_by parameter. Note: case get GRanges object data.frame. calculations always get kind average per locus. title: Summarizing bigWig files
text: may interested shape signal takes across set loci. calculated bw_profile. function takes locus provided bed file slices fixed number bins (determined bin_size parameter). bin aggregated together across loci. Note:. bw_profile returns data long format, since returns one value per data point. get: mean, standard error, median value per point. point represented index. index determines bin. can also provide upstream downstream base pairs values include calculation. Additionally, can use mode parameter define locus aligned binning. Available modes : start, end, center (align loci around points) stretch anchors features start end stretches length different.

title: Visualizing bigWig signal
text: Bin-based genome-wide analysis currently supported two formats: plot_bw_bins_violin. Makes violin plot one bigWig files. plot_bw_bins_scatter. Makes scatter plot two different bigWig files . plot types allow background bigWig signal provided (.e. input).

title: Visualizing bigWig signal
text: set bigWig files, possible visualize genome-wide signal distribution. example:  Note bin_size parameter influences time functions take run. Reasonable resolution 5000 10000. possible plot several bigWig files time:  Additionally, one can highlight bins overlap certain set interest loci. done via highlight parameter:  also possible provide list bigWig files used background normalize bin values . instance, previous case, one want use input values normalize H3.3 ChIP data:  norm_mode provided, possible log-transform values well:
code: plot_bw_bins_violin(h33_chip, bin_size = 2000, selection = locus) plot_bw_bins_violin(c(h33_chip, input_chip), bin_size = 2000, selection = locus) plot_bw_bins_violin(   c(h33_chip, input_chip),   bin_size = 2000,   highlight = genes,   highlight_color = c("red", "red"), # It is possible to provide different colors   selection = locus ) # bg_bwfiles parameter is set now to input_chip plot_bw_bins_violin(   h33_chip,    bg_bwfiles = input_chip,   bin_size = 2000,   highlight = genes,   highlight_color = c("red"),   selection = locus ) # bg_bwfiles parameter is set now to input_chip plot_bw_bins_violin(   h33_chip,    bg_bwfiles = input_chip,   bin_size = 2000,   highlight = genes,   highlight_color = c("#000088"), # Colors can be also HTML codes   norm_mode = "log2fc",   selection = locus )

title: Visualizing bigWig signal
text: can compare two signals scatter plot. , can use plot_bw_bins_scatter. function works similarly plot_bw_bins_violin instead accepting array bigWig files, accepts separate x y parameters corresponding optional bg_x bg_y, norm_mode_x, norm_mode_y. can see details function documentation. One example looking H3.3 versus H3K9me3 sample data:  useful see relationships marks. case, bins H3.3 signal high, H3K9me3 signal low viceversa. way plot_bw_bins_violin, possible specify set loci highlight within bins, normalize given signals:
code: plot_bw_bins_scatter(   x = h33_chip,   y = h3k9me3_chip,   bin_size = 2000,   selection = locus ) plot_bw_bins_scatter(   x = h33_chip,   bg_x = input_chip,   y = h3k9me3_chip,   bg_y = input_chip,   bin_size = 2000,   highlight = genes,   highlight_colors = "red",   highlight_label = "genes", # It is also possible to label the groups   norm_mode_x = "log2fc", # Each norm mode is provided separately   selection = locus )

text: plots meant provide genome-wide overview signal across different biologically-relevant categories. get list bigWig files BED file input. bigWig file represent row heatmap, cell aggregate value corresponding bigWig file given category BED file, example:  Since example reduced set HOXC genes, can see H3.3 signal high H3K9me3 generally low. possible previous types plots provide bigWig files normalization / input tracks use way :
code: # ChromHMM is a genome-wide annotation according to epigenetics marks. Each # locus is tagged by a category. And the amount of categories must be limited. # In this case, it is fifteen.  chrom_values <- import(chromhmm, format = "BED") head(chrom_values) #> GRanges object with 6 ranges and 2 metadata columns: #>       seqnames              ranges strand |           name     score #>          <Rle>           <IRanges>  <Rle> |    <character> <numeric> #>   [1]    chr15 102602601-102606600      * | 12_Heterochrom         0 #>   [2]    chr15 102606601-102607600      * |   11_Repressed         0 #>   [3]    chr15 102615401-102615800      * |   15_Insulator         0 #>   [4]    chr15 102615801-102616800      * |   11_Repressed         0 #>   [5]    chr15 102616801-102626600      * | 12_Heterochrom         0 #>   [6]    chr15 102626601-102627600      * |   11_Repressed         0 #>   ------- #>   seqinfo: 1 sequence from an unspecified genome; no seqlengths  plot_bw_loci_summary_heatmap(   c(h33_chip, h3k9me3_chip),   loci = chromhmm,   labels = c("H33", "H3K9me3") ) plot_bw_loci_summary_heatmap(   c(h33_chip, h3k9me3_chip),   bg_bwfiles = c(input_chip, input_chip),   loci = chromhmm,   labels = c("H33", "H3K9me3") )

title: Visualizing bigWig signal
text: Since function aggregating values, possible specify way per-locus values aggregated. Default true mean. means coverage values binned together mean performed category one big locus. Another possibilities : mean means (aggregate_by = "mean"), calculate mean coverage per locus aggregate value mean mean values, median means (aggregate_by = "median"). Median per-locus coverage values tend noisy, median means useful cases.

Genome partitioned equally-sized bins aggregated value calculated. Useful get general idea signal distribution without looking specific places. Across sets loci. can either summarized categories, individual values, genome-wide analyses. wigglescout functionality built two layers. Names functions calculate values bigWig files start bw_. return GRanges objects possible, data.frame objects otherwise (.e. values summarized category, genomic location lost process). hand, functions plot values usually make internal use bw_ functions, start plot_.

title: Wigglescout
text: package comes set small files show functionality. built published data Simon Elsässer’s lab correspond H3.3 H3K9me3 ChIP + input (GSE149080), subset across 500kbp genomic region: chr15-102600000-103100000, overlaps HOXC gene cluster. ChromHMM annotation also subset overlap region. values paths bigWig BED files.
code: library(ggplot2) library(rtracklayer) library(GenomicRanges) library(wigglescout)  h33_chip <- system.file("extdata", "sample_H33_ChIP.bw", package = "wigglescout") h3k9me3_chip <- system.file("extdata", "sample_H3K9me3_ChIP.bw", package = "wigglescout") input_chip <- system.file("extdata", "sample_Input.bw", package = "wigglescout") genes <- system.file("extdata", "sample_genes_mm9.bed", package = "wigglescout") chromhmm <- system.file("extdata", "sample_chromhmm.bed", package = "wigglescout")  locus <- GRanges(seqnames = "chr15", IRanges(102600000, 103100000))

title: Wigglescout
text: small example can wigglescout. code: plot_bw_bins_violin(   c(h33_chip, h3k9me3_chip),   bin_size = 2000,   labels = c("H3.3", "H3K9me3"),   remove_top = 0.001,   selection = locus # Plot can be subset to a certain GRanges. ) plot_bw_bins_violin(   c(h33_chip, h3k9me3_chip),   bin_size = 2000,   labels = c("H3.3", "H3K9me3"),   remove_top = 0.001,   highlight = genes,   selection = locus # Plot can be subset to a certain GRanges. ) plot_bw_bins_scatter(   h33_chip,   h3k9me3_chip,    bin_size = 2000,   remove_top = 0.001,   highlight = genes,   highlight_label = "Genes",   selection = locus # Plot can be subset to a certain GRanges. ) plot_bw_bins_density(   h33_chip,   h3k9me3_chip,   bin_size = 20000,   plot_binwidth = 0.05 ) plot_bw_loci_scatter(   h33_chip,   h3k9me3_chip,   loci = genes ) # ChromHMM is a genome-wide annotation according to epigenetics marks. Each # locus is tagged by a category. And the amount of categories must be limited. # In this case, it is fifteen.  chrom_values <- import(chromhmm, format = "BED") head(chrom_values) #> GRanges object with 6 ranges and 2 metadata columns: #>       seqnames              ranges strand |           name     score #>          <Rle>           <IRanges>  <Rle> |    <character> <numeric> #>   [1]    chr15 102602601-102606600      * | 12_Heterochrom         0 #>   [2]    chr15 102606601-102607600      * |   11_Repressed         0 #>   [3]    chr15 102615401-102615800      * |   15_Insulator         0 #>   [4]    chr15 102615801-102616800      * |   11_Repressed         0 #>   [5]    chr15 102616801-102626600      * | 12_Heterochrom         0 #>   [6]    chr15 102626601-102627600      * |   11_Repressed         0 #>   ------- #>   seqinfo: 1 sequence from an unspecified genome; no seqlengths  plot_bw_loci_summary_heatmap(   c(h33_chip, h3k9me3_chip),   loci = chromhmm,   labels = c("H33", "H3K9me3") ) plot_bw_profile(   c(h33_chip, h3k9me3_chip, input_chip),   loci = genes,   labels = c("H3.3", "H3K9me3", "Input") ) plot_bw_heatmap(   h33_chip,   loci = genes )

title: Wigglescout
text: functions work genome-wide data, often want run one bigWig file time. possible run regular laptop, however resolution high, waiting times raise minutes even hours, depending amount files given resolution. Intel i7 laptop, bins analyses single bigWig file resolution around 10000bp tend take seconds. 5000bp still reasonable interactive time. plotting 5000 bp resolution need wait quite time recommend running script outside R environment. Locus-based analyses runtime tends smaller since amount values calculated smaller genome-wide bins. exception ChromHMM plots, since also genome-wide bins, different lengths labeled categories. Keep mind plotting large set bigWig files. take time well.

title: Wigglescout
text: version 0.2.0, wigglescout core functions support future specifications using furrr library. means can run code multiple R sessions: advised implementing future planning within library function according future documentation: Please refrain modifying future strategy inside packages / functions, .e. call plan() code. Instead, leave control backend use end user. idea part core philosophy future framework - developer can never know future backends user access . Moreover, making assumptions backends available, code also work automatically new backends developed wrote code.

what: How to find the best configuration
title: Wigglescout
text: Parallelization wigglescout setting based fact operations multiple files done separately independently . However, requires passing data back forth, means bigWig files large (results get , instance, big GRanges objects), don’t many, may suffer overhead without getting benefit . easy rule thumb : swap sequential (default) multisession running functions multiple files . seems like benefit pretty much number files larger one. However, adding sessions seem help lot. Best guess going 2 4 workers. 2 workers already see considerable reduction time. expectation multicore may faster. However benchmarked , run within Rstudio.

title: Build a binned-scored GRanges object from a set of bigWig files — bw_bins
code: bw_bins(   bwfiles,   bg_bwfiles = NULL,   labels = NULL,   per_locus_stat = "mean",   bin_size = 10000,   genome = "mm9",   selection = NULL,   norm_mode = "fc",   remove_top = 0,   default_na = NA_real_,   scaling = "none",   canonical = FALSE )

title: Build a binned-scored GRanges object from a set of bigWig files — bw_bins
text: bwfiles Path array paths bigWig files summarized. bg_bwfiles Path array paths bigWig files used background. labels List names give mcols returned GRanges object. NULL, file names used. per_locus_stat Aggregating function (per locus). Mean default. Choices: min, max, sd, mean. bin_size Bin size. genome Genome. Available choices mm9, hg38. selection GRanges object restrict binning certain set intervals. useful debugging improving performance locus specific analyses. norm_mode Function apply normalize bin values. Default fc: divides bw / bg. Alternative: log2fc: returns log2(bw/bg). remove_top Return range 0-(1-remove_top). default returns whole distribution (remove_top == 0). default_na Default value missing values scaling none, operation performed (default). relative, values divided global mean (1x genome coverage). canonical Use canonical chromosomes (default: FALSE)

title: Build a binned-scored GRanges object from a set of bigWig files — bw_bins
text: GRanges object bwfile metadata column named labels, provided, filenames otherwise.

title: Build a binned-scored GRanges object from a set of bigWig files — bw_bins
text: bwfiles bg_bwfiles must length. using background several files, file paths must repeated accordingly. norm_mode can either "fc", values represent bigwig / bg_bigwig, "log2fc", values represent log2(bigwig / bg_bigwig) per bin.

The larger the bin size, the faster this is. bw_bins(bw, bin_size = 100000, labels = c("H33"), selection = locus) #> Warning: Not all bigWig files or the genome tiling provided share the same sequence info.  #>    Common to all (1): chr15   #>    Missing in some of the files: chr1, chr2, chr3, chr4, chr5 ...  #>    This can be due to different versions of the same reference genome, or to completely different organisms. code: bw_heatmap(   bwfiles,   bg_bwfiles = NULL,   loci = NULL,   labels = NULL,   mode = "stretch",   bin_size = 100,   upstream = 2500,   downstream = 2500,   middle = NULL,   ignore_strand = FALSE,   norm_mode = "fc",   default_na = NA_real_,   scaling = "none" )

title: Calculate heatmap matrix of a bigWig file over a GRanges or BED file — bw_heatmap
text: bwfiles Path array paths bigWig files summarized. bg_bwfiles Path array paths bigWig files used background. loci BED file GRanges summarize labels List names give mcols returned GRanges object. NULL, file names used. mode handle differences lengths across loci: stretch: Anchor locus sides. start: Anchor loci start. end: Anchor loci end. center: Center loci. bin_size Bin size. Length bin base pairs. lower, higher resolution. upstream Number base pairs include upstream loci. downstream Number base pairs include downstream loci. middle Number base pairs middle section (stretch mode). provided, median length loci used. ignore_strand Whether use strand information BED file. norm_mode Function apply normalize bin values. Default fc: divides bw / bg. Alternative: log2fc: returns log2(bw/bg). default_na Default value missing values scaling Whether use bigWig values (none - default) calculate relative enrichment (relative) dividing values global average.

title: Calculate profile values of a bigWig file over a BED file. — bw_profile
text: bwfiles Path array paths bigWig files summarized. bg_bwfiles Path array paths bigWig files used background. loci BED file GRanges summarize labels List names give mcols returned GRanges object. NULL, file names used. mode handle differences lengths across loci: stretch: Anchor locus sides. start: Anchor loci start. end: Anchor loci end. center: Center loci. bin_size Bin size. Length bin base pairs. lower, higher resolution. upstream Number base pairs include upstream loci. downstream Number base pairs include downstream loci. middle Number base pairs middle section (stretch mode). provided, median length loci used. ignore_strand Whether use strand information BED file. norm_mode Function apply normalize bin values. Default fc: divides bw / bg. Alternative: log2fc: returns log2(bw/bg). remove_top Return range 0-(1-remove_top). default returns whole distribution (remove_top == 0). default_na Default value missing values scaling Whether use bigWig values (none - default) calculate relative enrichment (relative) dividing values global average.

title: Plot a heatmap of a given bigWig file over a set of loci — plot_bw_heatmap
text: bwfiles BigWig file plot loci BED file GRanges summarize bg_bwfile Background bw file. Use care. Depending bin size actual values, may result noisy plot. mode handle differences lengths across loci: stretch: Anchor locus sides. start: Anchor loci start. end: Anchor loci end. center: Center loci. bin_size Bin size. Length bin base pairs. lower, higher resolution. upstream Number base pairs include upstream loci. downstream Number base pairs include downstream loci. middle Number base pairs middle section (stretch mode). provided, median length loci used. ignore_strand Whether use strand information BED file. norm_mode Function apply normalize bin values. Default fc: divides bw / bg. Alternative: log2fc: returns log2(bw/bg). cmap Color map. RColorBrewer palette name accepted . zmin Minimum color scale. Majority tools set 0.01 percentile data distribution. zmax Maximum color scale. Majority tools set 0.99. max_rows_allowed Maximum number loci allowed plot. amount loci exceeds value, plot binned y axis fits max_rows_allowed. speeds plotting large matrices, higher resolution perceivable eye. order_by Specific order display rows. default rows sorted decreasingly mean. Order array integers length number rows. can obtained result order() function, one want sort one heatmap values another one. verbose Put caption relevant parameters plot. default_na Default value missing values scaling Whether use bigWig values (none - default) calculate relative enrichment (relative) dividing values global average.

title: wigglescout 0.18.1
text: Restructuring vignettes smaller pieces information, deployment documentation website pkgdown.

title: wigglescout 0.18.0
text: keep_canonical function makes use GenomeInfoDb functionality exposed utility.

title: wigglescout 0.17.0
text: Extra canonical parameter bw_bins plot_bw_bins_density, plot_bw_bins_scatter allows exclude extra contigs reference genome. bw_bins related functions now check bigWig file references match tile genome provided, giving , initial warning potential references missing, suppressing individual “Unable summarize range” warning messages rtracklayer summary calculation.

title: wigglescout 0.16.1
text: Fixed issue importing formats different BED files. Now format guessing left rtracklayer narrowPeak files accepted. Fixes issue #98.

title: wigglescout 0.16.0
text: plot_bw_bins_density function introduced separate type figure plot_bw_bins_scatter functionality. Use density = TRUE plot_bw_bins_scatter soft-deprecated throw warning. Density plots tile layer rastered resolution 300dpi.

title: wigglescout 0.16.0
text: Vignettes now include example density plot.

title: wigglescout 0.15.6
text: Now scatterplots jitterplots violins raster layers, enough resolution prints (300dpi). considerably reduces size figures makes tractable editing. ggrastr now dependency.

title: wigglescout 0.15.5
text: Minor refactoring changes. Fixed issue tidyselect::exported.

title: wigglescout 0.15.4
text: Fixed warnings deprecations ggplot - removed appearances aes_string replaced recommended .data$field notation instead. Additionally, incorporated legend.position = inside profile plots. wigglescout now requires ggplot2 >= 3.5.0 due changes. Look figures improved better positioning legend, adequate base fontsize truncation long labels (>35 characters). Legend title summary heatmaps also shortened (background renamed bg). Verbose caption heatmaps shows order rows default (decreasing row means) user_provided. Bug fix #68 - colors now correctly assigned labels plot_bw_profile.

title: wigglescout 0.15.3
text: Testing refactor exclude much global variables possible. Now moved fixture rds files loaded demand, also necessary files generated fly per test function call removed withr. might generate bit overhead improves legibility maintainability tests.

title: wigglescout 0.15.2
text: Fixed #96: Inconsistency bw_loci summarized, normalized background remove_top > 0. Now loci selection exclusion done time background main samples. Fixed deprecation warnings tidyselect 1.1.0, 1.2.0, ggplot 3.4.0: aes_string replaced aes tidyselect now goes strings instead .data[[“string”]], explained : https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyverse.org/pull/600 impacts ggplot2, easy fix, since .data[[col]] also deprecated. calls dplyr::select use vectors replaced relevant tidyselect::all_of, tidyselect::any_of use. Extra deprecation warnings ggplot 3.4.0: linewidth replaces size line rectangle functions. versions packages deprecated added DESCRIPTION file, since breaking changes older versions. Added warning heatmap colorscale min == max. can happen due extremely sparse heatmaps. consistency, happens plotted using raw colorscale (instead quantiles (0.01, 0.99), use (min, max)).

title: wigglescout 0.15.1
text: Reimplemented granges_cbind function make use dplyr::left_join instead, improving robustness approach. Ranges also deduplicated merging. case granges locus one name, final granges object many rows names. .loci_to_granges now sort sequences, since necessary proper merging keeps consistency. .loci_to_granges now gets rid column name, interfere scoring naming.

title: wigglescout 0.15.0
text: Added bw_global_mean function. Takes bigwig file returns global mean coverage taking per-contig summary rtracklayer, multiplying contig length dividing sum global length. Added scaling parameter divides results global mean calculated bw_global_mean function, simulate 1x genome coverage tracks. affects calculating bw_ functions plotting functions: plot_bw_ backwards compatible (default anything). assigned correctly. affected instances BED file provided sorted. Might introduced recently, since older calculations still correct.

title: wigglescout 0.14.0
text: Added default_na parameter functions. makes use rtracklayer summary function defaultValue parameter. Bins loci values replaced given value instead. particularly useful sparse bigWig files, .aggregate_scores might kill majority rows due NA values.

title: wigglescout 0.13.9
text: .aggregate_scores robust presence NAs. rows NA values aggregated. affect results plot_bw_summary_heatmap bw_loci aggregate_by NULL.

title: wigglescout 0.13.8
text: .bw_ranges refactored make use .fetch_bigwig function.

title: wigglescout 0.13.7
text: bw_profile bug fix: remove_top now ignores NA values calculating rowMeans quantile. Documentation fix: Removed unnecessary packages README.

title: wigglescout 0.13.6
text: Refactor plot functions separate outlier filtering plotting reporting. reshape2 dependency melt removed favor tidyr pivot_longer. Explicit imports ggplot2 functions. Better handling decimal positions verbose plots. Remove soft-deprecated aes_string calls replace .data. Row aggregation now precise plot_bw_heatmap. Missing tick 0 heatmap row aggregation fixed back. Replaced 1 value.

title: wigglescout 0.13.5
text: lines 80 characters. Replace sapply() -> vapply(). Replace calls class() compare (obj, “class”). Replace T/F values TRUE/FALSE. Calls like warning(), stop() contain paste() calls error keywords. Indent 4 spaces . Plotting functions now dynamically match inner parameters. Tests inner parameter calls hence removed.

title: wigglescout 0.13.4
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Added biocViews terms. Fixed inconsistencies imports/suggests packages. Expanded description package. Correctly formated title tool. Made non-exported functions start dots. Added sessionInfo() end Vignettes. Added examples exported functions.
